text: Big Horn County is a county found in the U.S. state of Montana. As of the 2020 United States Census, there were 13,124 people. Its county seat is Hardin. The county was created in 1913. It is on the south line of the state. The county, like the river and mountain range, were named for the bighorn sheep in the Rocky Mountains. == References == Category:Montana counties Category:1913 establishments in Montana
title: Big Horn County, Montana
